title: Sprint king Bolt to get his Dortmund trial on Friday
text: March 22, 2018 / 1:08 PM / in 23 minutes Sprint king Bolt to get his Dortmund trial on Friday Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BERLIN (Reuters) - Multiple Olympic champion Usain Bolt will train with Borussia Dortmund on Friday as the retired Jamaican sprinter fulfils his ambition to workout with a major professional soccer team, the German club said on Thursday. FILE PHOTO: Soccer Football - Hublot Match of Friendship - Congress Center, Basel, Switzerland - March 21, 2018 Usain Bolt of Team Jose Mourinho in action with Roberto Carlos of Team Diego Maradona REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann The training session will be open to the public, with the world record holder in the 100 and 200 meters, who retired last year, a major crowd puller. Dortmund, who share the same sponsor in Puma as Bolt, expect a large crowd to attend the session. However, they warned fans that there was only limited space. The 31-year-old Bolt, an eight-times Olympic gold medalist and a big football fan, had announced his intention to train with Dortmund in January. He confirmed on Thursday he would be taking part. “BVB, get ready for Friday,” he said on Twitter. Bolt is a Manchester United supporter and jokingly said after a charity match on Thursday that he hoped his Dortmund appearance would lead to a contract with the Premier League club. Reporting by Karolos Grohmann, editing by Pritha Sarkar
